episodes.title: Testimonial Tuesday | "Forever Grateful"
Foundation Feed Series 11: Online Support Group for Former Scientologists
episodes.description:
In this episode of The Foundation Feed, Claire Headley and Phil Jones sit down to talk about one of the Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation’s most meaningful programs — the online support group facilitated by licensed therapist Rachel Bernstein.
This free, confidential group helps people recovering from Scientology find connection, understanding, and a path forward. Claire and Phil share how the program started, how it’s changing lives, and why emotional recovery is just as vital as financial or logistical support.
💬 In this conversation:
How the Aftermath Foundation’s support group works
Rachel Bernstein’s trauma-informed approach to recovery
What participants gain from the group experience
Stories of courage, connection, and healing
How supporters and donors make this work possible
Whether you’re in recovery yourself, know someone who is, or simply want to understand how the Foundation helps people rebuild their lives — this episode offers hope, insight, and inspiration.
🔗 Learn more: https://www.theaftermathfoundation.org
💖 Support our mission: https://www.theaftermathfoundation.org/donate
📧 Need help or want to join the group? Email: contact@theaftermathfoundation.org
📺 Subscribe to The Foundation Feed to hear more conversations about recovery, resilience, and real stories of life after Scientology.
#TheFoundationFeed #AftermathFoundation #ScientologyRecovery #RachelBernstein #ClaireHeadley #PhilJones #CultRecovery #LifeAfterScientology #HealingJourney

episodes.title: Testimonial Tuesday | "A Boost of Hope"
Testimonial Tuesday | "Life-Saving"
Foundation Feed Series #9: Ian Rafalko Part 2
Foundation Feed Series #8: News and updates
Testimonial Tuesday | "Taking Off"
Foundation Feed Series #7: Ian Rafalko
episodes.description:
Join us for a powerful live discussion hosted by the Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation. In this conversation, Claire Headley and Phil Jones sit down with Ian Rafalko to talk about his personal journey out of Scientology, how the Foundation supported him, and why he chose to speak out about Scientology’s abusive practices.
We’ll cover:
Ian’s background and what led him to break free.
The role the Aftermath Foundation played in providing support.
How speaking out helps others find the courage to leave.
Reflections on family, healing, and building a new life beyond Scientology.
This live conversation shines a light on the resilience of those who escape high-control groups and the importance of community support in the recovery process.
🔔 Subscribe to the Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation channel to stay updated on future conversations, survivor stories, and resources for those seeking freedom.
#AftermathFoundation #Scientology #SurvivorStories #IanRafalko

episodes.title: Testimonial Tuesday | "Rebuild Everything"
Foundation Feed Series #6: John Christiansen Part 2
episodes.description:
In this powerful continuation of our interview, John Christiansen will share the next chapter of his journey working alongside the Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation. Together, they helped Katherine Olson make her courageous escape after 29 years inside Scientology.
Part Two dives deeper into the challenges, risks, and critical moments that made Katherine’s freedom possible. John offers candid insight into the planning, emotional weight, and partnerships required to support someone leaving such a tightly controlled environment.
This episode highlights not just Katherine’s bravery, but also the importance of collaboration, compassion, and practical support for those finding their way out of high-control organizations.
👉 Don’t miss Part One if you haven’t seen it yet: https://www.youtube.com/live/jdtftqercSo?si=-1IcTZmJb1WLrCiZ
👉 Subscribe for more survivor stories, interviews, and resources from the Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation.
#Scientology #AftermathFoundation #CultRecovery #EscapeStories

episodes.title: Foundation Feed Series #4: Breaking Down Steven Hassan’s BITE Model & Scientology
episodes.description:
LIVE: Breaking Down Steven Hassan’s BITE Model & Scientology | Claire Headley & Phil Jones

Join us for a special live stream on The Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation channel with Claire Headley (Board President) and Phil Jones (Executive Director) as we dive into Steven Hassan’s BITE Model of Authoritarian Control—and explore how it directly applies to the experience of Scientologists.

We’ll discuss:
What the BITE Model is and why it matters in understanding high-control groups
How Behavior, Information, Thought, and Emotional control show up inside Scientology
Real-world examples from former Scientologists
Why breaking free from these systems can be so difficult—and what recovery looks like
How the Aftermath Foundation is helping people escape and rebuild their lives
This will be an interactive live stream—we’ll take your questions and comments throughout the discussion.

📅 Date & Time: Sunday, August 24th 3pm MST
📍 Where: The Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation YouTube Channel
👉 Don’t forget to subscribe and click the bell icon so you don’t miss it. Share this live with anyone who wants to understand how control works inside Scientology.

#Scientology #AftermathFoundation #StevenHassan #BITEModel #CultRecovery #ClaireHeadley #PhilJones

episodes.title: Foundation Feed Series #3: Life after Scientology with Katherine Olson
episodes.description:
Step behind the curtain with our third installment of the Foundation Feed series, featuring the courageous Katherine Olson as she shares her journey of life after Scientology.
What to Expect in this Episode:
A 27-Year Journey Unpacked: Katherine opens up about her time in Scientology’s Sea Organization and how that shaped her worldview—both then and now.
A Harrowing Escape: Discover how an unexpected act of kindness from an old friend led her to connect with the Aftermath Foundation, ultimately helping her break free from the organization.
Reflections on Freedom: Katherine offers deeply personal insights on what it means to rebuild a life beyond the confines of one of the world’s most controversial spiritual movements.

Timestamps:
00:00 – Introduction  
01:15 – Katherine’s life in the Sea Org  
05:30 – The turning point: How she connected with the Aftermath Foundation  
10:45 – Starting over: The early days of rebuilding life outside  
15:00 – Reflections on identity, healing, and hope for the future  

Don’t Miss:
Subscribe for more stories in our Foundation Feed series.
Share your thoughts—Are you curious about life transitions, healing, or personal freedom? Leave a comment below.
Support resources: www.theaftermathfoundation.org

Check out Katherine's photography here: https://rosewaterhause.myportfolio.com

Katherine's book recommendation for family with loved ones stuck in Scientology:

episodes.title: Foundation Feed Series #2: The Billboards - How it started and where we are now.
episodes.description:
Join Claire Headley and Phil Jones as they share the story of how the idea was born, the challenges faced, and the life-changing impact it’s had for those trapped inside Scientology’s control. From the first spark of inspiration to the tense moments of launching the campaign under intense scrutiny, you’ll hear what it really took to get the message out.

📢 What you’ll learn in this episode:

How the Aftermath Foundation connects with those still inside Scientology
The strategy behind choosing billboard locations
Personal stories from people who saw the billboards and reached out for help
The risks, pushback, and determination that made it all possible
💙 About The Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation
Our mission is to assist those escaping from Scientology and the Sea Org, providing practical help, resources, and a network of support so they can build safe, independent new lives.
👉 Subscribe to our channel to follow the Foundation Feed series and hear more real-life stories, courageous escapes, and powerful truths.
🔗 Learn more or support our work: https://aftermathfoundation.org

#AftermathFoundation #FoundationFeed #Scientology #BillboardCampaign #EscapeFromScientology #PhilJones #ClaireHeadley #SeaOrg #ExScientology #Freedom

episodes.description:
The Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation is a lifeline for those who feel they have nothing left after Scientology's total control of their lives and disconnection policies that destroy their families and relationships.
This is one such story.

For more information on how you can help us achieve our goals, please visit our website: https://bit.ly/AftermathFoundation

episodes.title: Foundation Feed Series #1: Updates from The Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation
episodes.description:
Dear Friends,
We’re thrilled to announce the launch of our new YouTube series, Foundation Feed, hosted by Claire Headley (Board President) and Phil Jones (Executive Director) of The Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation.
This weekly series will pull back the curtain on life inside Scientology, highlight survivor stories, and show how the Foundation is helping people escape and rebuild.
🎥 Watch the first episode Sunday August 2nd @ 2pm MST
📌 Subscribe to our channel →https://www.youtube.com/@UCMT-VOz9O6TLDHEgO6YOcaQ 

Our goal is to reach 10,000 subscribers — unlocking YouTube’s fundraising tools and helping us raise urgent funds for housing, crisis response, and survivor support.
Here’s how you can help:
✅ Watch the first episode
✅ Subscribe to the channel: https://www.youtube.com/@TheAftermathFoundation
✅ Share with friends, survivors, and supporters
Thank you for your ongoing support.
Warmly,
The Michael J. Rinder Aftermath Foundation
[www.theaftermathfoundation.org] | [https://www.youtube.com/@TheAftermathFoundation] | [https://theaftermathfoundation.networkforgood.com/projects/205488-general-donation-page]

episodes.title: The Sea Org is a highly controlled environment #shorts
The homophobia in Scientology #shorts
The Aftermath Foundation and the CFC
episodes.description:
CFC is the Combined Federal Campaign, the most rigorously screened workplace giving program for all current and retired Federal employees. Participation also affords us the opportunity to make presentations to multiple Federal agencies on the work The Aftermath Foundation does. 

For example, last year we did presentations to Veteran’s Affairs, Department of Homeland Security, FAA, Department of Defense and other agencies. 

We are excited to announce that we were approved for a second year of participation with the CFC!

#acceptance #community #help #support #survivors #theaftermathfoundation #cfc #combinedfederalcampaign #approved #givingprogram

episodes.title: Feeling unprepared for living outside of Scientology #shorts
Communication is restricted in the Sea Org #shorts
Leaving Scientology with Rachael Hastings
episodes.description:
This is the second video in our mini series, "Leaving Scientology".

The Aftermath Foundation exists to help people leave Scientology and start new lives. Many of those we help prefer to stay anonymous, given the litigious and disruptive nature of Scientology and its practices of Fair Game. It can be very challenging to start a new life after Scientology. We are tremendously grateful for the opportunities our work affords us to help people start over. We've put together several videos to document recent successes. Please share and help us spread the word on this important work. 

If you'd like to support our efforts, please visit: www.theaftermathfoundation.org. 

Thanks for watching! #scientology #aftermath #cults #cultsurvivors #freedom

episodes.title: The Story of Serge Obolensky: An Aftermath Foundation Documentary
episodes.description:
www.theAftermathFoundation.org

The Aftermath Foundation was established to help those who want to leave Scientology and the Sea Organization, but who lack a system of support they can rely on while getting on their feet in the outside world.

Serge was raised in scientology from a very young age and joined the Sea Organization at age 11, committing to a billion years of service to scientology. Serge's parents and his brothers were also part of the Sea Organization. After several years of hard labor, no education, no family support and a rigorous schedule, Serge's life was in ruins. At age 19, while he was living on L Ron Hubbard Way, Serge had a fireworks accident in which he lost both of his hands and one of his eyes. Thereafter he was promptly cut off from his family and all mental and emotional support, as a result of which Serge was homeless on Hollywood Blvd for 10 years.

The Aftermath Foundation presents: The Story of Serge Obolensky.

#scientology #aftermathfoundation

episodes.title: The Aftermath Foundation: An Introduction
episodes.description:
Welcome to The Aftermath Foundation!
Our purpose is to help those who want to leave Scientology and/or the Sea Organization, but who lack a system of support that they can rely on while getting on their feet in the outside world.
Our board of volunteers is dedicated to providing resources, support, education, and advocacy for those who have been adversely affected by scientology practices and raising public awareness on this organization.
Learn more here: www.theaftermathfoundation.org
